docs.title: CanSat 2025 Firmware
docs.text: Test

docs.title: Types
docs.text: Name Description RadioFrequencySelector Represents the radio frequency selector switch ClimateData Represents data from the climate sensor (BME280) GpsModule Represents the GPS module BlinkPattern Represents a pattern to blink in ClimateSensor Represents the climate sensor (BME280) DateTime Represents date and time GpsData Represents the data that the GPS module returns Position Represents the location of the satellite ParachuteDeployer Represents the mechanism that will release the parachute RadioFrequency Represents a radio frequency RadioModule Represents the long-range radio module (LoRa) SdCardModule Represents the SD card module StatusLed Represents the status LED

docs.title: Type Aliases
docs.text: Name Description Pin Represents a hardware GPIO pin

docs.title: Pin
docs.text:
using Pin = int

Represents a hardware GPIO pin

docs.title: BlinkPattern
docs.text:
struct BlinkPattern

Represents a pattern to blink in

docs.title: Variables
docs.text: Name Description shortDuration The maximum number of blinks longBlinkDuration The duration of the short blinks in milliseconds (the long blinks are twice as long) pattern The number of short and long blinks in total

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description BlinkPattern A pattern of long and short blinks Default constructor (creates a pattern with length 0) BlinkPattern Constructs a blink pattern where the duration of the short blinks is 100 milliseconds

docs.title: longBlinkDuration
docs.text:
static const int longBlinkDuration

The duration of the short blinks in milliseconds (the long blinks are twice as long)

docs.title: pattern
docs.text:
bool pattern[MAX_NUM_BLINKS]

The number of short and long blinks in total

docs.title: shortDuration
docs.text:
static const int shortDuration

The maximum number of blinks

docs.title: BlinkPattern
docs.text:
BlinkPattern()

A pattern of long and short blinks Default constructor (creates a pattern with length 0)

BlinkPattern(bool pattern[MAX_NUM_BLINKS], int numBlinks)

Constructs a blink pattern where the duration of the short blinks is 100 milliseconds

docs.title: ClimateData
docs.text:
struct ClimateData

Represents data from the climate sensor (BME280)

docs.title: Variables
docs.text: Name Description temperature Temperature in degrees celsius pressure Relative air pressure in kPa humidity Relative humidity in percentages altitude Altitude in meters above sea level

docs.title: humidity

Relative humidity in percentages

docs.title: pressure
docs.text:
float pressure

Relative air pressure in kPa

docs.title: temperature
docs.text:
float temperature

Temperature in degrees celsius

docs.title: ClimateSensor
docs.text:
class ClimateSensor

Represents the climate sensor (BME280)

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description ClimateSensor The sensor will use the given pins for I2C communication sclPin : The pin that will be used as SCL sdaPin : The pin that will be used as SDA begin Initialises the sensor using the given pins read Reads the latest data from the sensor Return : Returns the climate data

docs.title: ClimateSensor
docs.text:
ClimateSensor(Pin sclPin, Pin sdaPin)

The sensor will use the given pins for I2C communication

sclPin The pin that will be used as SCL sdaPin The pin that will be used as SDA

docs.title: begin
docs.text:
void begin()

Initialises the sensor using the given pins

docs.title: read
docs.text:
ClimateData read()

Reads the latest data from the sensor
Return Returns the climate data

docs.title: GpsData
docs.text:
struct GpsData

Represents the data that the GPS module returns

docs.title: Variables
docs.text: Name Description dateTime The date and time when the GPS data was collected position The latitude, longitude and altitude speed Speed in meters per second

DateTime dateTime

The date and time when the GPS data was collected

docs.text:
Position position

The latitude, longitude and altitude

docs.title: speed

float speed

Speed in meters per second

docs.title: GpsModule
docs.text:
class GpsModule

Represents the GPS module

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description GpsModule The GPS module will use the given pins for its input and output rxPin : The pin that will be used for recieving data txPin : The pin that will be used for transmitting data begin Sets up the hardware UART using the given pins read Reads any new data from the GPS module and returns with the latest information

docs.title: GpsModule
docs.text:
GpsModule(Pin rxPin, Pin txPin)

The GPS module will use the given pins for its input and output

rxPin The pin that will be used for recieving data txPin The pin that will be used for transmitting data

docs.title: begin
docs.text:
void begin()

Sets up the hardware UART using the given pins

docs.title: read
docs.text:
GpsData& read()

Reads any new data from the GPS module and returns with the latest information

docs.title: ParachuteDeployer
docs.text:
class ParachuteDeployer

Represents the mechanism that will release the parachute

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description ParachuteDeployer The solanoid will use the given pin for it's input pin : The output pin begin Configures the given pin to OUTPUT mode lock Close the solanoid and lock the parachute release Open the solanoid and release the parachute

docs.title: ParachuteDeployer
docs.text:
ParachuteDeployer(Pin pin)

The solanoid will use the given pin for it's input

pin The output pin

docs.title: begin
docs.text:
void begin()

Configures the given pin to OUTPUT mode

docs.title: lock
docs.text:
void lock()

Close the solanoid and lock the parachute

docs.title: release
docs.text:
void release()

Open the solanoid and release the parachute

docs.text: Name Description RadioFrequency Creates a radio frequency value : The radio frequency in kHz

434.0 kHz

docs.title: RadioFrequencySelector
docs.text:
class RadioFrequencySelector

Represents the radio frequency selector switch

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description RadioFrequencySelector The specified pin will be used as input from the radio frequency selector switch pin : The pin that will be configured as the input during begin() begin Configures the given pin to INPUT mode read Read the currently selected radio frequency Return : Reaturns the currently selected radio frequency

docs.title: RadioFrequencySelector
docs.text:
RadioFrequencySelector(Pin pin)

The specified pin will be used as input from the radio frequency selector switch

pin The pin that will be configured as the input during begin()

docs.title: begin
docs.text:
void begin()

Configures the given pin to INPUT mode

docs.title: read
docs.text:
RadioFrequency read()

Read the currently selected radio frequency
Return Reaturns the currently selected radio frequency

docs.title: RadioModule
docs.text:
class RadioModule

Represents the long-range radio module (LoRa)

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description RadioModule The long-range radio module (LoRa) will use these pins for recieving and transmitting data rxPin : The pin that will be used for reciving data txPin : The pin that will be used for transmitting data begin Sets up the hardware UART connection and configures the radio module to upload mode sendPrimaryData Sends the primary data (temperature and pressure) to the ground station temperature : Temperature in degrees celsius pressure : Relative air pressure in kPa sendSecondaryData Sends the GPS position of the satellite to the ground station position : The current GPS position of the satellite setRadioFrequency Sets the operating radio frequency of the module radioFrequency : Radio frequency in kHz

docs.title: RadioModule
docs.text:
RadioModule(Pin rxPin, Pin txPin)

The long-range radio module (LoRa) will use these pins for recieving and transmitting data

rxPin The pin that will be used for reciving data txPin The pin that will be used for transmitting data

docs.title: begin
docs.text:
void begin()

Sets up the hardware UART connection and configures the radio module to upload mode

docs.title: sendPrimaryData
docs.text:
void sendPrimaryData(float temperature, float pressure)

Sends the primary data (temperature and pressure) to the ground station
temperature Temperature in degrees celsius pressure Relative air pressure in kPa

docs.title: sendSecondaryData
docs.text:
void sendSecondaryData(Position position)

Sends the GPS position of the satellite to the ground station
position The current GPS position of the satellite

docs.title: setRadioFrequency
docs.text:
void setRadioFrequency(RadioFrequency radioFrequency)

Sets the operating radio frequency of the module
radioFrequency Radio frequency in kHz

docs.title: SdCardModule
docs.text:
class SdCardModule

Represents the SD card module

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description SdCardModule The SD card module will use the specified SCK, MISO, MOSI and CS pins sckPin : The pin that will be used as SCK misoPin : The pin that will be used as MISO (master in, slave out) mosiPin : The pin that will be used as MOSI (master out, slave in) csPin : The pin that will be used as CS begin Sets up and mounts the SD card using the given SPI pins saveData Save data to the SD card climateData : Climate data from the climate sensor (BME280) gpsData : GPS data from the GPS module

docs.title: SdCardModule
docs.text:
SdCardModule(Pin sckPin, Pin misoPin, Pin mosiPin, Pin csPin)

The SD card module will use the specified SCK, MISO, MOSI and CS pins

sckPin The pin that will be used as SCK misoPin The pin that will be used as MISO (master in, slave out) mosiPin The pin that will be used as MOSI (master out, slave in) csPin The pin that will be used as CS

docs.title: begin
docs.text:
void begin()

Sets up and mounts the SD card using the given SPI pins

docs.title: saveData
docs.text:
void saveData(ClimateData& climateData, GpsData& gpsData)

Save data to the SD card
climateData Climate data from the climate sensor (BME280) gpsData GPS data from the GPS module

docs.title: StatusLed
docs.text:
class StatusLed

Represents the status LED

docs.title: Variables
docs.text: Name Description pin The gap between each blink pattern in milliseconds currentPattern The pin that will be used as ouput to the LED wasPatternCompleted The current blink pattern ledOffTimer Was the current pattern completed The current index in the pattern ledOnTimer The timer that will turn off the LED when it runs out

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description createTimer The timer that will turn on the LED when it runs out Creates a timer using the given arguments callback : The member function to use as the callback name : The name of the timer timer : The timer handle ledOnTimerCallback Turns on the LED and starts the ledOffTimer ledOffTimerCallback Turns on the LED and starts the ledOnTimer startBlinking Starts the ledOffTimerCallback immediately StatusLed The specified pin will be used as output to the status LED pin : The pin that will be configured as the output during begin() begin Sets the given pin to OUTPUT blink Starts blinking the given pattern if there is no active pattern

docs.title: currentPattern
docs.text:
BlinkPattern currentPattern

The pin that will be used as ouput to the LED

docs.title: ledOffTimer
docs.text:
esp_timer_handle_t ledOffTimer

Was the current pattern completed The current index in the pattern

docs.title: ledOnTimer
docs.text:
esp_timer_handle_t ledOnTimer

The timer that will turn off the LED when it runs out

docs.title: pin
docs.text:
Pin pin

The gap between each blink pattern in milliseconds

docs.title: wasPatternCompleted
docs.text:
bool wasPatternCompleted

The current blink pattern

docs.title: StatusLed
docs.text:
StatusLed(Pin pin)

The specified pin will be used as output to the status LED
pin The pin that will be configured as the output during begin()

docs.title: begin
docs.text:
void begin()

Sets the given pin to OUTPUT

docs.title: blink
docs.text:
void blink(BlinkPattern pattern)

Starts blinking the given pattern if there is no active pattern

docs.title: createTimer
docs.text:
void createTimer(void (StatusLed::*callback)(), String name, esp_timer_handle_t* timer)

The timer that will turn on the LED when it runs out Creates a timer using the given arguments

callback The member function to use as the callback name The name of the timer timer The timer handle

docs.title: ledOffTimerCallback
docs.text:
void ledOffTimerCallback()

Turns on the LED and starts the ledOnTimer

docs.title: ledOnTimerCallback
docs.text:
void ledOnTimerCallback()

Turns on the LED and starts the ledOffTimer

docs.title: startBlinking
docs.text:
void startBlinking()

Starts the ledOffTimerCallback immediately
